Container.AcceptedItemTypesTooltip: This section allows you to specify which item types are accepted by the container.
Container.AffectsEncumbranceTooltip: If disabled, contained items no longer affect character encumbrance.
Container.EquippedBulkMultiplierTooltip:
This multiplier is used for altering the bulk of the current item when it is equipped.
Setting this to 0 will make the current item not count its own bulk towards the actor's encumbrance when equipped.
Container.CapacityTooltip: How many 'slots' that can be utilized within this container.
Container.CapacityBulkTooltip: How much bulk can be contained within this container.
Container.StorageIdentifierTooltip: The kind of storage slot that is represented by this storage section.
Container.StorageTypeTooltip: This property defines if a storage section measures its contents in bulk or in slots.

Interface.DragFromExternalTokenError: Cannot drag items from token actors not on the active scene.
Interface.DragToExternalTokenError: Cannot drag items to token actors not on the active scene.
Interface.ItemCollectionLocked: This container is locked and will not open.
Interface.NoTarget: No target actor or token specified.
Interface.DeleteConfirmationMessage: Are you sure you wish to delete '{itemName}'?
Interface.AmountToTransferMessage: Please enter the amount of items you want to transfer.

ItemValue.Label: Wealth:
ItemValue.Tooltip: This number represents the sum total value of all of the items on this list.

ItemBrowser.SearchHint: You can type the name of the item you are searching for.
ItemBrowser.Title: Browse Items

Interface.NoTargetTokenForItemDrop: No target token, cannot drop item!

EncounterTracker.SelectNextType: Switch to the next combat type
EncounterTracker.SelectPrevType: Switch to the previous combat type

Errors.HistoryLimitedResetInitiative:
The current phase has reset initiative, we cannot go back further in history.

Click to dismiss.
Errors.HistoryLimitedStartOfEncounter:
You have reached the start of the encounter, we cannot go back further in history.

Click to dismiss.
Errors.MissingInitiative:
The current phase has reset initiative, please re-roll initiative on all combatants before continueing.

Click to dismiss.

1.Name: Combat
1.Description: Everyone may now act out their combat turn.

1.Name: Changing Roles
1.Description: Anyone who wishes to change starship roles, may do so now.

2.Name: Engineering
2.Description: Captains, Engineers, Magic Officers, Chief Mates and Deck Hands may choose to act during this phase.

3.Name: Piloting Check
3.Description: Pilots may now roll their piloting checks to determine this round's initiative.

4.Name: Helm
4.Description: Captains, Pilots, Science Officers, Chief Mates and Deck Hands may choose to act during this phase.

5.Name: Gunnery
5.Description: Captains, and Gunners may choose to act during this phase.

6.Name: Damage
6.Description: Everyone now processes their received damages, critical thresholds, etc.

1.Name: Pilot Actions
1.Description: Drivers may now decide their maneuvers.

2.Name: Chase Progress
2.Description: The GM will now process the chase progress results.

3.Name: Combat
3.Description: Everyone may now act out their combat turn.

Invalid input for the following fields:

Chassis.SourceTooltip: Where does this chassis come from? Which book? What page?

Weapons.Both: Weapons (Equiped weapon mounts: Melee {meleeCurrent} of {meleeMax}, Ranged {rangedCurrent} of {rangedMax})

Mod.SourceTooltip: Where does this drone mod come from? Which book? What page?

Skills.NoSkillsAvailable: This drone does not have any skills available.

SFRPG.FlagDeprecationNotice: NOTE: These values are being replaced by the new modifiers system and will be removed in a future update. It is recommended that you uncheck any of these values and add them as a modifer on the Modifiers tab.
SFRPG.FlagsInstructions: Configure character features and traits which fine-tune behaviors of the Starfinder system.
SFRPG.GreatFortitudeHint: Character feat that adds 2 to fortitude saving throws
SFRPG.ImprovedInitiativeHint: Character feat that adds 4 to thier initiaive roll
SFRPG.InvalidStarshipItem: {name} is an invalid Item for a starship.
SFRPG.IronWillHint: Character feat that adds 2 to will saving throws

ItemCollectionSheet.ItemCollectionLocked: This container is locked and will not open.

Settings.DeleteIfEmptyTooltip:
Delete when Emptied
Should this container token automatically be removed when the last item is removed from it?

Capacity.CapacityMaxTooltip: The max number of charges this item can hold
Capacity.HeaderTooltip: The number of rounds, charges, etc... that can be held by this item (eg, the number of charges a battery can hold)
Capacity.UsageTooltip: The amount of charges, peices of ammuntition, etc.. that are consummed when this item is used.
Capacity.UsageValueTooltip: The time unit used to determine when the item's capacitiy is consumed.

Equipment.ContainerTooltip: Equipment typically can contain armor upgrades, or other items. Increase the storage capacity to allow adding content.

Containers.ContainerTooltip: Containers can contain just about any item. Increase the storage capacity to allow adding content.

Header.ArmorClassTooltip:
Armor Class
The armor class of this item, if left unattended. Otherwise, the attendee's armor class should be used instead.
An item is considered unattended if it is not currently under any influence of a character.
Header.HardnessTooltip:
Hardness
When taking damage, subtract the item's hardness from the incoming damage before applying.
Header.HitpointsTooltip:
Hitpoints
The amount of hitpoints available for this item.
An item is considered 'broken' if it has damage.
An item is considered 'destroyed' when its hitpoints are reduced to 0.
Header.ItemNameTooltip:
Item Name
The name given to this item.
Header.SaveTooltip:
Save DC
Formula: {formula}
This is the saving throw modifier for this item.
Header.SourceTooltip:
Source
Used primarily to denote what rules document this item came from

PhysicalProperties.ArmorClassTooltip:
Armor Class
The armor class of this item, if left unattended. Otherwise, the attendee's armor class should be used instead.
An item is considered unattended if it is not currently under any influence of a character.
PhysicalProperties.CustomBuiltTooltip: Was this item crafted by a character, or mass-produced?
PhysicalProperties.DexterityModifierTooltip: If inanimate, an item's dexterity modifier is -5.
PhysicalProperties.HardnessTooltip:
Hardness
When taking damage, subtract the item's hardness from the incoming damage before applying.

Hitpoints.CurrentTooltip: The amount of hitpoints this item has.
Hitpoints.HeaderTooltip:
Hitpoints
The amount of hitpoints available for this item.
An item is considered 'broken' if it has damage.
An item is considered 'destroyed' when its hitpoints are reduced to 0.
Hitpoints.MaxTooltip: The maximum amount of hitpoints this item can have. Leave blank for automatic calculation.

PhysicalProperties.SizeTooltip: By default, an item's size is medium. Item sizes affect the item armor class, alter as needed.
PhysicalProperties.SturdyTooltip: Equipment, such as weapons and armors, are considered sturdy.

Weapons.ContainerTooltip: Weapons typically can contain weapon fusions and weapon upgrades. Increase the storage capacity to allow adding upgrades and fusions.

SFRPG.LightningReflexesHint: Character feat that adds 2 to reflex saving thorws
SFRPG.MigrationBeginingMigration: Attempting to apply Starfinder system migration to version {systemVersion}. Please be patient and do not close your game or shutdown your server.
SFRPG.MigrationEndMigration: Starfinder system migration to version {systemVersion} was successful!
SFRPG.MigrationErrorMessage: There was an error migrating your Starfinder data, you made a backup, right?
SFRPG.MigrationSuccessfulMessage: Your Starfinder data was successfully migrated to the current version.
SFRPG.ModifierEffectTypeTooltip: This identifies the general attribute or attributes that are affected by the modifier
SFRPG.ModifierEnabledTooltip: Determines if the modifier will be considered when the attribute modifiers are calculated
SFRPG.ModifierModifierTooltip: The value used to modify with.
SFRPG.ModifierModifierTypeTooltip: A modifier can be a constant value (+2) or a roll formula (+1d4). This is used to identifiy the Modifier field as one or the other
SFRPG.ModifierNotesTooltip: Any specific notes about his modifier
SFRPG.ModifierSourceTooltip: Where does this modifier come from? An item? A spell? Another character?
SFRPG.ModifierTypeTooltip: The modifiers type. Used for figuring out which modifier to use when multiple modifiers are of the same type (usually the highest)
SFRPG.ModifierValueAffectedTooltip: This identifies a specific value being affected if the general attribute has many possible values

Conditions.Warning: * NPCs do not support automatic modifier calculations yet!

CreateItem.Name: New Item
CreateItem.Note: Select the type of item you would like to create.
CreateItem.Title: Create New Item

SFRPG.RepairDroneDialogDescription: Repair your drone? The default rate is up to 10% of the drone's max HP per 10 minutes, if you have the Repair Drone (Ex) feat, you can instead repair up to 25% of the drone's max HP.
SFRPG.RepairDroneDialogImprovedFeat: Use the Repair Drone (Ex) feat rules
SFRPG.RepairDroneUnnecessary: {name} is already at max hit points, no repairs needed.
SFRPG.RestSChatMessageRestored: {name} takes a short 10 minute rest, and spent {spentRP} Resolve Point to recover {regainedSP} Stamina Points.
SFRPG.RestSDescription: Take a short rest? On a short rest you may spend one Resolve Point to recover all Stamina Points.

Advantage.Hint: Enables the ability to toggle advantage or disadvantage on dice rolls.
Advantage.Name: Use advantage and disadvantage?

AutoCollapseCard.Hint: Automatically collapse Item Card descriptions in the Chat Log
AutoCollapseCard.Name: Collapse Item Cards in Chat

CombatCards.NormalHint: Change which combat chat cards should be displayed during normal combat.
CombatCards.StarshipHint: Change which combat chat cards should be displayed during starship combat.
CombatCards.VehicleChaseHint: Change which combat chat cards should be displayed during vehicle chases.

DiagonalMovementRule.Hint: Configure which diagonal movement rule should be used for games within this system.
DiagonalMovementRule.Name: Diagonal Movement Rule

ExperienceTracking.Hint: Remove experience bars from character sheets.
ExperienceTracking.Name: Disable Experience Tracking

UseCustomChatCard.Hint: Toggle whether to use the new custom chat cards or the original ones.
UseCustomChatCard.Name: Use custom Starfinder chat card?

UseQuickRollAsDefault.Hint: When clicking abilities that roll dice, the roll will act as if the Shift key was depressed by default. This will trigger a fast-forwarded roll.
UseQuickRollAsDefault.Name: Use Quick roll by default?

UseStarfinderAOETemplates.Hint: Whether to use Starfinder's measurement method for AOE templates vs Foundry VTT's default method
UseStarfinderAOETemplates.Name: Use Starfinder AOE templates

WorldSchemaVersion.Hint: Records the data schema version for the Starfinder system. WARNING: Do not edit this value unless you know what you are doing!
WorldSchemaVersion.Name: Starfinder Data Schema Version
